original: Majjhima Nikāya 13
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Mahādukkhakkhandhasutta
analyzed: mahādukkhakkhandhasutta
translated: The Greater Discourse on the Mass of Suffering

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: Once the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

original: Atha kho sambahulā bhikkhū pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya sāvatthiṁ piṇḍāya pāvisiṁsu.
analyzed: atha kho sambahulāḥ bhikkhū pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya sāvatthim piṇḍāya pāvisisu
translated: Then, in the morning, a number of monks put on their robes and, carrying their bowls and outer robes, went into Sāvatthī for alms.

original: Atha kho tesaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ etadahosi:
analyzed: atha kho tesam bhikkhūnam etat ahosi
translated: Then the thought occurred to them,

original: “atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyaṁ piṇḍāya carituṁ,
analyzed: atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyam piṇḍāya caritu
translated: “It’s too early to wander for alms in Sāvatthī.

original: yaṁ nūna mayaṁ yena aññatitthiyānaṁ paribbājakānaṁ ārāmo tenupasaṅkameyyāmā”ti.🔽Atha kho te bhikkhū yena aññatitthiyānaṁ paribbājakānaṁ ārāmo tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā tehi aññatitthiyehi paribbājakehi saddhiṁ sammodiṁsu;
analyzed: yam nūna mayam yena añña titthiyānam paribbājakānam ārāmo tena upasaṅkameyyāma ati  atha kho te bhikkhū yena añña titthiyānam paribbājakānam ārāmaḥ tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā tehi añña titthiyehi paribbājakehi saddhim sammodisu
translated: Why don’t we go to the park of the wanderers of other sects?”🔽So they went to the park of the wanderers of other sects. On arrival they exchanged courteous greetings with the wanderers of other sects.

original: sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu. Ekamantaṁ nisinne kho te bhikkhū te aññatitthiyā paribbājakā etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdisu ekamantam nisinne kho te bhikkhū te añña titthiyāḥ paribbājakāḥ etat avocuḥ
translated: After an exchange of friendly greetings & courtesies, they sat to one side. As they were sitting there, the wanderers said to them,🔽“Friends, the contemplative Gotama describes the gratification, the danger, & the escape in the case of sensual pleasures, but he doesn’t describe the gratification, the danger, & the escape in the case of sensual desire.

original: “samaṇo, āvuso, gotamo kāmānaṁ pariññaṁ paññapeti, mayampi kāmānaṁ pariññaṁ paññapema;🔽samaṇo, āvuso, gotamo rūpānaṁ pariññaṁ paññapeti, mayampi rūpānaṁ pariññaṁ paññapema;
analyzed: samaṇaḥ āvuso gotamaḥ kāmānam pariññam paññapeti mayam pi kāmānam pariññam paññapema  samaṇaḥ āvuso gotamaḥ rūpānam pariññam paññapeti mayam pi rūpānam pariññam paññapema
translated: “The ascetic Gotama describes the full understanding of sensual pleasures, and so do we.🔽The ascetic Gotama describes the full understanding of forms, and so do we.

original: samaṇo, āvuso, gotamo vedanānaṁ pariññaṁ paññapeti, mayampi vedanānaṁ pariññaṁ paññapema;🔽idha no, āvuso, ko viseso, ko adhippayāso, kiṁ nānākaraṇaṁ samaṇassa vā gotamassa amhākaṁ vā—
analyzed: samaṇaḥ āvuso gotamaḥ vedanānam pariññam paññapeti mayam pi vedanānam pariññam paññapema  idha no āvuso kaḥ visesaḥ kaḥ adhippayāsaḥ kim nānākaraṇam samaṇassa vā gotamassa amhākam vā
translated: The ascetic Gotama describes the full understanding of feelings, and so do we.

original: yadidaṁ dhammadesanāya vā dhammadesanaṁ, anusāsaniyā vā anusāsanin”ti?🔽Atha kho te bhikkhū tesaṁ aññatitthiyānaṁ paribbājakānaṁ bhāsitaṁ neva abhinandiṁsu, nappaṭikkosiṁsu;
analyzed: yat idam dhamma desanāya vā dhamma desana anusāsaniyā vā anusāsanin ti  atha kho te bhikkhū tesam añña titthiyānam paribbājakānam bhāsitam na iva abhinandisu na paṭikkosisu
translated: What is the difference, the distinction, or the superiority of the ascetic Gotama’s teaching compared to ours?”🔽Those monks neither approved nor disapproved of what those wanderers of other sects said.

original: anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkamiṁsu:
analyzed: an abhinanditvā a paṭikkositvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkamisu
translated: Without doing either they rose from their seats and left,

original: “bhagavato santike etassa bhāsitassa atthaṁ ājānissāmā”ti.
analyzed: bhagavato santike etassa bhāsitassa attham ājānissāma ati
translated: thinking, “We will learn the meaning of these words in the presence of the Buddha.”

original: Atha kho te bhikkhū sāvatthiyaṁ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhū sāvatthiyam piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattam piṇḍapāta paṭikkantā
translated: Then, after robing up in the morning, the monks took their bowls and robes and entered Sāvatthī for alms.

original: yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
analyzed: yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdisu
translated: After walking for alms in Sāvatthī, they returned, and after their meal they went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnā kho te bhikkhū bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:🔽“idha mayaṁ, bhante, pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya sāvatthiṁ piṇḍāya pāvisimha.🔽Tesaṁ no, bhante, amhākaṁ etadahosi:
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnāḥ kho te bhikkhū bhagavantam etat avocuḥ  idha bhante pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya sāvatthim piṇḍāya pāvisimha  tesam naḥ bhante amhākam etat ahosi
translated: and told him what had happened.

original: ‘atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyaṁ piṇḍāya carituṁ,🔽yaṁ nūna mayaṁ yena aññatitthiyānaṁ paribbājakānaṁ ārāmo tenupasaṅkameyyāmā’ti.
analyzed: atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyam piṇḍāya caritu  yam nūna mayam yena añña titthiyānam paribbājakānam ārāmo tena upasaṅkameyyāma ati
translated: “Just now, reverend Sir, after walking for alms in Sāvatthī, we returned, and after our meal we went to the park of the wanderers of other sects.

original: Atha kho mayaṁ, bhante, yena aññatitthiyānaṁ paribbājakānaṁ ārāmo tenupasaṅkamimha; upasaṅkamitvā tehi aññatitthiyehi paribbājakehi saddhiṁ sammodimha;
analyzed: atha kho bhante yena añña titthiyānam paribbājakānam ārāmaḥ tena upasaṅkamimha upasaṅkamitvā tehi añña titthiyehi paribbājakehi saddhim sammodimha
translated: We exchanged greetings with them, and after this courteous and amiable talk we sat down to one side.

original: sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdimha. Ekamantaṁ nisinne kho amhe, bhante, te aññatitthiyā paribbājakā etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdimha ekamantam nisinne kho amhe bhante te añña titthiyāḥ paribbājakāḥ etat avocuḥ
translated: and after a friendly and courteous exchange of greetings and courtesies, we sat down to one side. The wanderers then said to us:

original: ‘samaṇo, āvuso, gotamo kāmānaṁ pariññaṁ paññapeti, mayampi kāmānaṁ pariññaṁ paññapema.🔽Samaṇo, āvuso, gotamo rūpānaṁ pariññaṁ paññapeti, mayampi rūpānaṁ pariññaṁ paññapema.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ āvuso gotamaḥ kāmānam pariññam paññapeti mayam pi kāmānam pariññam paññapema  samaṇaḥ āvuso gotamaḥ rūpānam pariññam paññapeti mayam pi rūpānam pariññam paññapema
translated: ‘Friend, the ascetic Gotama describes the full understanding of sensual pleasures, and so do we.🔽The ascetic Gotama describes the full understanding of forms, and so do we.

original: Samaṇo, āvuso, gotamo vedanānaṁ pariññaṁ paññapeti, mayampi vedanānaṁ pariññaṁ paññapema.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ āvuso gotamaḥ vedanānam pariññam paññapeti mayam pi vedanānam pariññam paññapema
translated: The ascetic Gotama describes the full understanding of feelings, and so do we.

original: Idha no, āvuso, ko viseso, ko adhippayāso, kiṁ nānākaraṇaṁ samaṇassa vā gotamassa amhākaṁ vā, yadidaṁ dhammadesanāya vā dhammadesanaṁ anusāsaniyā vā anusāsanin’ti.
analyzed: idha no āvuso kaḥ visesaḥ kaḥ adhippayāsaḥ kim nānākaraṇam samaṇassa vā gotamassa amhākam vā yat idam dhamma desanāya vā dhamma desanam anusāsaniyā vā anusāsaninti
translated: What then is the difference, the distinction, the distinction in the true Dhamma between the ascetic Gotama’s teaching of the Dhamma and our teaching of the Dhamma, between his instructions and ours?’

original: Atha kho mayaṁ, bhante, tesaṁ aññatitthiyānaṁ paribbājakānaṁ bhāsitaṁ neva abhinandimha, nappaṭikkosimha;
analyzed: atha kho maya bhante tesam añña titthiyānam paribbājakānam bhāsitam na iva abhinandimha na paṭikkosimha
translated: Then, Lord, we neither rejoiced in the words of those wanderers of other sects nor did we disapprove of them.

original: anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkamimha:
analyzed: an abhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkamimha
translated: without approving or disapproving of his words, we got up from our seats and left, thinking:

original: ‘bhagavato santike etassa bhāsitassa atthaṁ ājānissāmā’”ti.
analyzed: bhagavato santike etassa bhāsitassa attham ājānissāma ati
translated: and without approving or disapproving of his words, we got up from our seats and left, thinking, ‘We will learn the meaning of these words in the presence of the Buddha.’“

original: “Evaṁvādino, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evamassu vacanīyā:
analyzed: eva vādinaḥ bhikkhave añña titthiyāḥ paribbājakāḥ evam assu vacanīyāḥ
translated: “Monks, when the wanderers of other sects speak like this, they should be asked:

original: ‘ko panāvuso, kāmānaṁ assādo, ko ādīnavo, kiṁ nissaraṇaṁ?
analyzed: kaḥ pana āvuso kāmānam assādaḥ kaḥ ādīnavaḥ kim nissaraṇa
translated: ‘But what, friends, is the gratification, the danger, and the escape in the case of sensual pleasures?

original: Ko rūpānaṁ assādo, ko ādīnavo, kiṁ nissaraṇaṁ?
analyzed: kaḥ rūpānam assādaḥ kaḥ ādīnavaḥ kim nissaraṇa
translated: What is the gratification, the danger, and the escape in the case of forms?

original: Ko vedanānaṁ assādo, ko ādīnavo, kiṁ nissaraṇan’ti?
analyzed: kaḥ vedanānam assādaḥ kaḥ ādīnavaḥ kim nissaraṇan ti
translated: What is the gratification, the danger, and the escape in the case of feelings?’

original: Evaṁ puṭṭhā, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā na ceva sampāyissanti, uttariñca vighātaṁ āpajjissanti.
analyzed: evam puṭṭhāḥ bhikkhave añña titthiyāḥ paribbājakāḥ na ca iva sampāyissanti uttarim ca vighātam āpajjissanti
translated: When asked this, the wanderers of other sects will not manage an answer and, what is more, they will get into trouble.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Yathā taṁ, bhikkhave, avisayasmiṁ.
analyzed: yathā ta bhikkhave
translated: Because it is beyond their domain.

original: Nāhaṁ taṁ, bhikkhave, passāmi sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā
analyzed: na aham ta bhikkhave passāmi sa devake loke sa mārake sa brahmake sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇiyā
translated: I do not see that person in the world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this generation with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—

original: pajāya sadevamanussāya yo imesaṁ pañhānaṁ veyyākaraṇena cittaṁ ārādheyya, aññatra
analyzed: pajāya sa deva manussāya yaḥ imesam pañhānam veyyākaraṇena cittam ārādheyya aññatra
translated: who could satisfy the mind with an answer to these questions,🔽except for a Tathāgata, a Buddha, a Blessed One.

original: tathāgatena vā tathāgatasāvakena vā, ito vā pana sutvā.
analyzed: tathāgatena vā tathāgata sāvakena vā itas vā pana sutvā
translated: or a disciple of the Buddha, or having heard it from them.

original: Ko ca, bhikkhave, kāmānaṁ assādo?
analyzed: kaḥ ca bhikkhave kāmānam assādaḥ
translated: “And what, bhikkhus, is the gratification in sensual pleasures?

original: Pañcime, bhikkhave, kāmaguṇā.
analyzed: pañcime bhikkhave kāma guṇāḥ
translated: There are these five cords of sensual pleasure.

original: Katame pañca?
analyzed: katame pañca
translated: What five?

original: Cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṁhitā rajanīyā,🔽sotaviññeyyā saddā …pe…
analyzed: cakkhu viññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piya rūpā kāma upasahitā rajanīyā  sota viññeyyā saddāḥ pe
translated: Forms cognizable by the eye that are wished for, desired, agreeable and likeable, connected with sensual desire, and provocative of lust.🔽Sounds cognizable by the ear…

original: ghānaviññeyyā gandhā …
analyzed: ghāna viññeyyāḥ gandhāḥ
translated: Odours cognizable by the nose…

original: jivhāviññeyyā rasā …
analyzed: jivhā viññeyyāḥ rasāḥ
translated: Flavours cognizable by the tongue…

original: kāyaviññeyyā phoṭṭhabbā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṁhitā rajanīyā—
analyzed: kāya viññeyyā phoṭṭhabbā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piya rūpā kāma upasahitā rajanīyā
translated: Tangibles cognizable by the body that are wished for, desired, agreeable and likeable, connected with sensual desire, and provocative of lust.

original: ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca kāmaguṇā.
analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave pañca kāmaguṇā
translated: These are the five cords of sensual pleasure.

original: Yaṁ kho, bhikkhave, ime pañca kāmaguṇe paṭicca uppajjati sukhaṁ somanassaṁ—ayaṁ kāmānaṁ assādo.
analyzed: yam kho bhikkhave ime pañca kāmaguṇe paṭicca uppajjati sukham somanassa ayam kāmānam assādaḥ
translated: The pleasure and joy that arise in dependence on these five cords of sensual pleasure are called the gratification in sensual pleasures.

original: Ko ca, bhikkhave, kāmānaṁ ādīnavo?
analyzed: kaḥ ca bhikkhave kāmānam ādīnavaḥ
translated: “And what, bhikkhus, is the danger in sensual pleasures?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, kulaputto yena sippaṭṭhānena jīvikaṁ kappeti—
analyzed: idha bhikkhave kula puttaḥ yena sippa ṭṭhānena jīvikam kappeti
translated: Here, bhikkhus, a clansman by nature is very passionate. He engages in sensual pleasures to a high degree.

original: yadi muddāya yadi gaṇanāya yadi saṅkhānena yadi kasiyā yadi vaṇijjāya yadi gorakkhena yadi issatthena yadi rājaporisena yadi sippaññatarena—
analyzed: yadi muddāya yadi gaṇanāya yadi saṅkhānena yadi kasiyā yadi vaṇijjāya yadi gorakkhena yadi issatthena yadi rāja porisena yadi sippaññatarena
translated: whether by agriculture, business, raising cattle, archery, government service, or learning—

original: sītassa purakkhato uṇhassa purakkhato ḍaṁsamakasavātātapasarīsapasamphassehi rissamāno khuppipāsāya mīyamāno;
analyzed: sītassa purakkhataḥ uṇhassa purakkhataḥ ḍasama kasa vāta ātapa sarīsapa samphassehi rissamānaḥ khuppipāsāya mīyamānaḥ
translated: he suffers cold and heat; hunger and thirst; contact with flies, mosquitoes, wind, sun, and serpents; and he is exposed to danger.

original: ayampi, bhikkhave, kāmānaṁ ādīnavo sandiṭṭhiko, dukkhakkhandho kāmahetu kāmanidānaṁ kāmādhikaraṇaṁ kāmānameva hetu.
analyzed: ayam pi bhikkhave kāmānam ādīnavaḥ sandiṭṭhikaḥ dukkha kkhandhaḥ kāma hetu kāma nidānam kāma adhikaraṇam kāmānam eva hetu
translated: This drawback too appears in one who enjoys sensual pleasures.

original: Tassa ce, bhikkhave, kulaputtassa evaṁ uṭṭhahato ghaṭato vāyamato te bhogā nābhinipphajjanti.🔽So socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṁ kandati, sammohaṁ āpajjati:
analyzed: tassa ce bhikkhave kula puttassa evam uṭṭhahataḥ ghaṭataḥ vā āyamataḥ te bhogāḥ na abhinipphajjanti  saḥ socati kilamati paridevati uras tāḷim kandati sammoham āpajjati
translated: “If, while he is thus striving and struggling and exerting himself, he does not succeed in gaining wealth,

original: ‘moghaṁ vata me uṭṭhānaṁ, aphalo vata me vāyāmo’ti.
analyzed: mogham vata me uṭṭhāna aphalaḥ vata me vāyāmaḥ iti
translated: he sorrows, grieves, and laments, beats his breast, becomes distraught: ‘My striving has been fruitless, my striving has borne no fruit!’🔽This drawback too appears in one who enjoys sensual pleasures.

original: Ayampi, bhikkhave, kāmānaṁ ādīnavo sandiṭṭhiko dukkhakkhandho kāmahetu kāmanidānaṁ kāmādhikaraṇaṁ kāmānameva hetu.
analyzed: ayam pi bhikkhave kāmānam ādīnavaḥ sandiṭṭhikaḥ dukkha kkhandhaḥ kāma hetu kāma nidānam kāma adhikaraṇam kāmānam eva hetu
translated: “Again, a noble disciple considers thus:

original: Tassa ce, bhikkhave, kulaputtassa evaṁ uṭṭhahato ghaṭato vāyamato te bhogā abhinipphajjanti.🔽So tesaṁ bhogānaṁ ārakkhādhikaraṇaṁ dukkhaṁ domanassaṁ paṭisaṁvedeti:
analyzed: tassa ce bhikkhave kula puttassa evam uṭṭhahataḥ ghaṭataḥ vā āyamataḥ te bhogāḥ abhinipphajjanti  so tesam bhogānam ārakkha adhikaraṇam dukkham domanassam paṭisavedeti
translated: he experiences pain and grief in guarding that wealth:

original: ‘kinti me bhoge neva rājāno hareyyuṁ, na corā hareyyuṁ, na aggi daheyya, na udakaṁ vaheyya, na appiyā dāyādā hareyyun’ti.
analyzed: kinti me bhoge na iva rājānaḥ hareyyu na corāḥ hareyyu na aggi daheyya na udakam vaheyya na appiyāḥ dāyādāḥ hareyyunti
translated: ‘How can neither kings nor thieves make off with my wealth, nor fire burn it, nor water carry it off, nor hateful heirs make off with it?’

original: Tassa evaṁ ārakkhato gopayato te bhoge rājāno vā haranti, corā vā haranti, aggi vā dahati, udakaṁ vā vahati, appiyā vā dāyādā haranti.
analyzed: tassa evam ārakkhataḥ gopayataḥ te bhoge rājānaḥ vā haranti corāḥ vā haranti aggi vā dahati udakam vā vahati appiyāḥ vā dāyādāḥ haranti
translated: While he is thus guarding and protecting his wealth, kings may make off with it, or thieves may make off with it, or fire may burn it, or water may carry it off, or hateful heirs may make off with it.

original: So socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṁ kandati, sammohaṁ āpajjati:
analyzed: saḥ socati kilamati paridevati uras tāḷim kandati sammoham āpajjati
translated: He sorrows, grieves and laments, beats his breast, weeps and becomes distraught,

original: ‘yampi me ahosi tampi no natthī’ti.
analyzed: yam pi me ahosi tam pi no natthi iti
translated: saying: ‘What was mine is no more!’

original: Ayampi, bhikkhave, kāmānaṁ ādīnavo sandiṭṭhiko, dukkhakkhandho kāmahetu kāmanidānaṁ kāmādhikaraṇaṁ kāmānameva hetu.
analyzed: ayam pi bhikkhave kāmānam ādīnavaḥ sandiṭṭhikaḥ dukkha kkhandhaḥ kāma hetu kāma nidānam kāma adhikaraṇam kāmānam eva hetu
translated: This is the danger in sensual pleasures, the future peril, in regard to sensual desires, which is seen here and now, in the form of suffering and grief.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, kāmahetu kāmanidānaṁ kāmādhikaraṇaṁ kāmānameva hetu rājānopi🔽rājūhi vivadanti, khattiyāpi khattiyehi vivadanti, brāhmaṇāpi brāhmaṇehi vivadanti,🔽gahapatīpi gahapatīhi vivadanti, mātāpi puttena vivadati, puttopi mātarā vivadati,🔽pitāpi puttena vivadati, puttopi pitarā vivadati, bhātāpi bhātarā vivadati, bhātāpi
